--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Gordon Mohr (archive.org)"
<gojomo=
@a...> wrote:
>
> andlanna wrote:
> > Hi there, 
> > 
> > I'm having a stra=
nge problem with Heritrix. When I criate a simple
> > job, consisting with =
one or more seeds from the same domain (eg:
> > http://www.zzz.com.br/ and =
http://www.zzz.com.br/aaa), and create an
> > exclude filter with the URIRe=
gExpFilter, the URI's that are covered by
> > the regular expression has no=
t been crawled... It's perfect! 
> > 
> > But, when I create a job (or a pr=
ofile), with an override for the
> > domain of the seed (http://www.zzz.com=
.br, in my example), and use the
> > same filter of the single job, it has =
not been applied. The URI's that
> > I don't want, are beeing captured. 
> =
> 
> > Anybody has an idea of what is happening?
> 
> One idea of something=
 to check: is the override set up as intended?
> 
> I believe stray space/d=
ot characters can lead to confusion, as can
> the way overrides are hierarc=
hically organized in reverse-order of
> hostname parts. That is, inside the=
 (possibly empty) 'br' override,
> is a (possibly empty) 'com.br' override,=
 which has inside it a
> (possibly empty) 'zzz.com.br' override, which has =
inside it the
> 'www.zzz.com.br' override.
> 
> Hope this helps,
> 
> - Gor=
don @ IA
>


Hi Gordon, 

In fact what you said it's happening. Only the lo=
wer level of the
hierarchy (that corresponds to http://www.zzz.com.br) cont=
ains any
configuration. Others levels are empty. 

But I want to apply thes=
e filters on the URI's from a specific domain.
For example:
* http://www.zz=
z.com.br/page.php?id=3D### (this URI is desired)
* http://www.zzz.com.br/se=
ction/page.php (this URI is desired too)
* http://www.zzz.com.br/print.php?=
id=3D### (this URI is not desired,
because the content was visited before, =
the id's are the same and the
uri has just the content on a good format for=
 printing)
* http://www.zzz.com.br/sectionNotDesired/page.php (this URI is =
not
desired, because it's section does not matter)

To apply 2 URIRegExpFil=
ters on these URI's I created a override from
the address http://www.zzz.co=
m.br/. I think that it's sufficient to
cover the main content and the secti=
ons of the seed. So the filters
are on the lower level of the hierarchy (co=
rrespondent to
http://www.zzz.com.br). 

Am I doing anything wrong? Or mayb=
e is it a bug from Heritrix. 

Once more, thanks very much for the support.=


Andr=E9 Lanna
